Jane Tagged me.  Haven't updated the music files much lately.  Here Goes:

5 Of my current favorite songs.  Er, I'm changing this to well-liked.  "Favorite" is impossible.

1. "Venus In Furs" and "Heroin" The Velvet Underground
2. "Kimberly" Patti Smith
3. "When I Look at the World" U2
4. "White Rabbit" Jefferson Airplane
5. "Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds" The Beatles

And the new Switchfoot album... "Happy is a Yuppie Word" is my fav.

Tag.  Ben, you're it.
U2 THIS WEEK!!!!

I've done this before, but Sarah did it for me, and if you see number 8, it will all come together.

Leave your name(via comment) and
1. I'll respond with something random about you.
2. I'll tell you what song/movie reminds me of you.
3. I'll pick a flavor of jello to wrestle with you in.
4. I'll say something that only makes sense to you and me.
5. I'll tell you my first/clearest memory of you.
6. I'll tell you what animal you remind me of.
7. I'll ask you something that I've always wondered about you.
8. If I do this for you, you must post this on your journal.

I'm getting braces monday.





Remember that picture of you in the 6th grade with frizzy hair, mis-matched clothes, and braces?  Three days and that will be me.

Y - Year you were born? 1986.

Z - Zodiac Sign? Gemini

Yeah... show last night... Just read everyone else's LJ... its the exact same story.

Thinking of quitting andrews and working at the ymca as fitness staff.  Pro's/Cons...

Pros: get away from boss-from-hell, who gives me at least one irrational and wrongly-assumed exploding scolding each shift.  get away from butloads of bullshit.  increased pay.  no driving whatsoever.  ymca = 2 blocks from my house.  no disgusting greasy food feeling.  no disgusting food.  no excuse not to work out.  better schedule.  no "on call" obligations (honestly... what is Andrew thinking... the only other prfession who requires on call is that of a doctor.  it's making me sacrifice 2 nights of my week- mustr be totally free for their convienence with no compensation to me whatsoever)

cons: leaving one or two really cool people.  free salad bar.  (um, my home-made salads are way better)  Not getting to dress up to work at 228.  and, er, applying and hoping i'm accepted...

I know the grass is always greener, blablabla.  but i don't care.

What's your opinion??
http://onesweetllama.livejournal.com/25431.html

A Quick and Dirty IQ Test
http://onesweetllama.livejournal.com/25261.html

Hah.  Haven't been 'round here in a while.  

This weekend was the suckiest thing that has happened since er... well, I'll leave THAT part to myself... But seriously, I wasn't me.  At all.  It might have been because I couldn't find my medication, thus didn't take it, which my doctor said would be hell to stop cold turkey for even a day- and I witnessed two; or for other reasons which, er, I'll also keep to myself, (jeez, this is a crappy post); and I'm sure part of it was spiritual warfare, but this morning I am feeling much more at peace.  

I just read a blurb by Michelle about how she has changed in the past year.  Hmm, in the past two years I see so many shades of me that I don't know which one is true.  Nor which one I like the best.  Ack, this ramble is starting to sound like that fruity simpson song.  Oh I gotta get outta here before I REALLY shame myself.  

Here's to the nutty nights!!
PS The thing I hate about clubbing is all the manwhores.  They really paint a bad picture for men in general, and when good, honorable, Leah-worthy men are hard to come by, being scandalized by scum is not the most heartening thing in the world.
http://onesweetllama.livejournal.com/24911.html

Oh am I ever so sore from yesterday... and the day before.  Went running twice and worked out at the gym for an hour working muscles not otherwise used.  Those stability balls can be killer if used right!
I have to go to the beach with my family this weekend for a boating trip.  We didn't see my dad for father's day so this is its substitute.  Dagnabbit I wanted to go to gator-ville with my girls to XS.  All the Polecats say, "Purrrrroww!"

Remember the cookie contest Jeff planned months ago?  The one that never happened?
This saturday at Ryan's... COOKIE BAKEOFF.  
Call me, Ryan, or Ben.

Got your attention, didn't I?  Not that type, marley.  Ben and I's birthdays are a week apart, so huge party this comming saturday, June 11.  Swimming, a Lapete-cow-BBQing, (ironic...maybe I'll have tofu rotating on a spit like Marzipan over in the corner somewhere) fireworks... and who knows whatelse.  byob.  I'll be drinking coffee.  Give me a holla if you wanna come and I'll give you all the details.

I got a boy to go see Sisterhood of the Travelling Pants with me.  I can do anything.  Ben was the only boy in the theatre.  

Also there are about 2 roads through Valdosta.  We got lost on the wrong one, then on the right one, in the wrong direction.

I need help! Any html/java literate (whatever have you; computer goo-roos in my terminology) come to my rescue!! I don't need fixing or anything, just a few questions.

The Keys to Your Heart

You are attracted to those who are unbridled, untrammeled, and free.
In love, you feel the most alive when things are straight-forward, and you're told that you're loved.
You'd like to your lover to think you are optimistic and happy.
You would be forced to break up with someone who was ruthless, cold-blooded, and sarcastic.
Your ideal relationship is open. Both of you can talk about everything... no secrets.
Your risk of cheating is zero. You care about society and morality. You would never break a commitment.
You think of marriage as something precious. You'll treasure marriage and treat it as sacred.
In this moment, you think of love as something you don't need. You just feel like flirting around and playing right now.
What Are The Keys To Your Heart?

I opened the door and held it for a male coworker who had his hands full.  He smiled, then with a free two fingers opened the adjacent door and held it for me saying, "Thankyou Leah, but I am a gentleman.  After you."  

Wow.  That is chivalry.
http://onesweetllama.livejournal.com/22538.html

Your Birthdate: June 16
Your birth on the 16th day of the month gives a sense of loneliness and generally the desire to work alone. You are relatively inflexible, and insist on your being independent. You need a good deal of time to rest and to meditate. You are introspective and a little stubborn. Because of this, it may not be easy for you to maintain permanent relationships, but you probably will as you are very much into home and family. This birth day inclines to interests in the technical, the scientific, and to the religious or the unknown realm of spiritual explorations. The date gives you a tendency to seek unusual approaches and makes your style seem a little different and unique to those around you. Your intuition is aided by the day of your birth, but most of your actions are bedded in logic, responsibility, and the rational approach. You may be emotional, but have a hard time expressing these emotions. Because of this, there may be some difficulty in giving or receiving affection.
What Does Your Birth Date Mean?
Dang, that's actually pretty accurate. Except for the science and technology part. The last time I was sick was junior year of HS. I suppose I am mortal after all. Dangit.

AGH I HAVE TO MOVE OUT NOW!!!

I locked my keys in my car yesterday.  Some guys lurking behind Fat Sandwich tried to help with a slim jim but no success.  And I couldn't find a coat hanger (I've been successful w/ one before) so I went to the police station.  they first said that since I was parked off campus that they couldn't do it.  when i said i have a monte carlo ss they argued over who would get to break in. 

I have GOT to move out of my parents' house asap.  It KILLS the social life.  It sucks to have tasted freedom, then have to get used to all the old rules again.  I mean, People are just now going out... and I am stuck here because It's "pretty much curfew anyway"  GRRR.  No one tells me when nor where I can't go.

Anyone need roomates?!?  Sarah Moore, are we still on for the fall?
http://onesweetllama.livejournal.com/21614.html

Step 1: Get your playlist together, put it on random, and play.
Step 2: Pick your favorite lines from the first 10 songs that play.
Step 3: Post and let everyone you know guess what song the lines come from.
Step 4: Cross out the songs when someone guesses correctly.
Step 5: Kill those who google the lyrics

Yes folks, yours truly finally has her own cell phone.  I think I am the last person in Tallahassee to get one.  Seriously.  But call my house first.  I get a whole whopping 5 minutes a day.  Unless you have cingular.  Then I can talk your ears off for free.  So open your little black books: 597-0006.  

Capitol Speedway show was alright.  Maybe I was just not in the mood for it.  I dunno.  I hate 2/3 of the crowd they draw.  I endured the set more than enjoyed it.  Man, I feel old and senile.  And yes Ryan, I was there.  You should have been too.  Go to E3 Sunday with Ward.  I am!

Yet while we were still sinners, Christ died for us.  What a demonstration of love.

I spent the weekend with my grandparents in St. Petersburg.  :)  They're the cute kind that you would want to wrap up in blankets and feed them cookies.  Grandma and I spent an afternoon exploring an Impressionist exhibit at the Museum of Fine Arts.  It featured "Monet's London," a collection inspired by Monet's <I> Houses of Parliament, Effect of Fog <I> consisting of over 140 reflections of the Tames by various Impressionists.  My favorite were actually two little etchings on paper by Felix Buhot.  Check him out, he's pretty clever.

We visited the Extreme Home Makeover house in St. Petersburg (the guy was shot and blinded in a gas station stick up and now goes to grandma's church); saw Terri Schaivo's clinic, outside of which, stood many protesters; and drove by the memorial service for Jessica, the girl they had found murdered a few days ago.  So I have had a well-rounded hands on lesson in historical/current events this weekend. 

And gooo... If anyone ever needs to stay in Perry, FL for some strange reason, go to the Best Western.  It's ranked #1 in the world, and I believe it.  We stopped by to take refuge from the storm on the way home and upon entering, were warmly greeted by two hosts and offered wine (Merlot, Chardonnay or a cocktail?) and were then ushered into a dining room furnished with white and dark chocolate covered strawberries, cookies, fruit, coffees and teas.  We weren't even staying there... just running from the storm.  Anyway, go there.  It's only $70 a night.

I get my wisdom teeth out wednesday!  If anyone wants to see Leah's face all fat (a once in a lifetime event!) or see her on some serious drugs, don't come by my house because you will be rejected.  I am going into hiding.  Unless you bring coffee from afar.
http://onesweetllama.livejournal.com/19730.html

I wanted to start this entry with a creative, witty statement to lure you people into reading... but I just don't feel like it.  Forever Changed show was excellent.  Late-night social outing that was much overdue for me, as i've been a homebody for a few months.  Saw a few people that i haven't seen in a while- Eric, Ryan, Austin, and Cody.  I hadn't seen Cody for over a year.  FC put on an amazing show.  One of their best, most certainly.  

Ben, Ryan, Jeff, Ward and I went to see The Ring II last night.  Now that I look back on it, it is hilariously funny, but it wasn't last night.  I screamed, jumped, and slapped myself in the face in attempts to cover my eyes more than Ben did, and sure, I was more scared than he was, but I also watched about twice as much as he did.  He hid behind my coat half the time.  Later I pulled all of my hair down in front of my face to mimic the girl and scared Jeff and Ben.  

Easter is approaching.  I am ashamed of my recent lack of devotion and admiration.  I desperately need to spend some time with my Creator.  I'm craving Him, but that devil sure is good at preventing me from fulfilling that craving.  Oooooo he makes me so angry.

I miss Patty and Dolores ad nauseam.
http://onesweetllama.livejournal.com/19515.html

Emma gave birth to 5 stillborn kittens.  I took her to the vet out of serious concern and they found that she had an incurable blood disease.  They put her down.  He said it was for her own good.  I miss how she would purr incessantly.  I called her 'my little purr factory.'
http://onesweetllama.livejournal.com/19270.html

Your suggestions for an abloodymazing book.  Anything from:

Mystery
Classics
Adventure
Philosophy
Creepy :)
Girly

I'm dying for some worthwhile reading... You know what to do!!

I went to my first class friday!  It was review for me, but sadly enough either all of the class was not in the mood, or they were completely lost and off in lalaland, but no one would contribute to "class discussion." Heh i actually miss the 1st semester class- at least they were interesting due to their trippy worldviews.  However an FSU basketball player is in it.  6'8" and huge, I stand just barely above his lowest rib.  I think he's the biggest person I've ever met.

More like back from captivity.  But yes, it could have escalated to the title.  For those of you who do not know, I was sent to Remuda,an in-patient treatment center in Arizona for anorexics and bulimics.  Two months living with 30 girls from across the nation who suffer from the same disease- just imagine.  At home i felt alone.  Friends and family could sympathize, but never fully understand.  However, I was amazed to find that anorexics across the map all have the same, bizarre, thwarted mindset.  We had a culture of our own.  

Anorexia is one of the most misunderstood diseases.  That's what it is: a mental disease.  So many factors can contribute to its development; family dynamics, trauma, verbal abuse...  Mine were acceptance and control.  But I won't get into that.  By the time I would have fully explained it you would be snoring.  But I will say that it's a horrid disease- one that imperialises and distorts the mind.  A few have accused me of corrupted vanity, quite possibly thinking that the illness was a cry for attention or even a simple, egotistical, shallow phase.  I suppose that yes, most eating disorders are cries for attention, but I would certainly not attribute them to the desire for popularity, vanity, or really nothing of the sort.  It simply signifies emotional needs left unfulfilled.  Maybe the victim has an emotionally absent father, or is surrounded by external pressures to perform perfectly in every way possible.  Often times a very low self esteem plays a role.  I used Ed (I characterize the Eating Disorder as a person.  you can see I've been in therapy too long!) to fill the lonely void, to gain a sense of control, and to claim an identity.  It seemed as though everyone else had something they were known for- the actress, the musician, the genius, the anorexic.  After a while I knew I had to live up to the title.  Ah I could go on but I think you get the general picture.  All I am trying to say is that it is a very real disease, and it's addicting.  It progressively requires more and more starvation to produce the same effects, the same satisfaction.  Biologically, the brain can not perceive an image by its true proportions... but only when that image is the one looking back at you in the mirror.  The thing looking back at me was rather large.  It was not until weeks into my recovery that I saw a photo and realized the toll it had taken.  In the photo I looked dead. 

On the brighter side Remuda was the best thing that has ever happened to me.  I now feel more alive and joyful than I have in years.  I am more myself than I have been in months!  With that said, I need to apologize to the friends that I was a sucky friend to.  You know who you are.  But hey, I am back, spitfire and all.  I give all glory to God.
